decision_conditions: An application to fell trees covered by a tree preservation order should be accompanied with evidence showing the need for the tree(s) removal. This should either be a report showing:
a)  that the tree(s) health or structural condition is so poor that pruning or other works can no longer retain the tree(s) in a safe condition.
b) That the tree has been proven to be causing structural damage.
This requirement is clearly stated on the TPO application form (Section 8).

As this evidence has not been provided with the application, Ealing Council refuses permission to remove the protected tree(s). | We are aware that the storm-damaged tree T13 failed during a storm over a year ago. However, T12 is missing, and no permission has been granted by the council. |

The tree you are referring to is T27 on the map.  As with all of the other conditions above, we suggest a professional survey is provided by an accredited Arboricultural Consultant to support application.
application_type_full: Tree works: Trees in conservation areas/subject to TPOs
